title: Finbar's unit sales to foreigners plunge on 7pc tax in WA
text:
Off-the-plan apartment sales to foreign buyers in WA have crashed since the state government introduced a 7 per cent surcharge at the start of the year, new figures from developer Finbar show.

The listed apartment developer reported just 18 sales to overseas investors in the first 10 months of the year, having sold 98 apartments to this buyer segment over the same period in 2018, and 65 apartments in 2017.

Finbar's Civic Heart development in Perth.

The figures were included in Finbar's AGM presentation and market update in Perth on Tuesday.

The declining number of foreign buyer sales delivered another blow to Finbar, which has battled the tough local conditions since mid-2017, with operating profits falling from a peak of $40 million in financial 2014, to a little over $10 million in the year ended June 30.
description: Listed developer Finbar reported just 18 sales to overseas investors since January, down from 98 apartment sales to foreigners a year ago.
